reviewText: Wow...it's great to see such a wonderful program again after all these years. I grew up in the Bronx, New York and watched this show every day. Carole and Paula were a beautiful, calming and educational presence in my childhood. It's too bad that kids nowadays need endless stimulation, sarcastic cartoons, video games and cellphones to be entertained. "The Magic Garden" takes me back to a much simpler time. I loved the lengthy segment on creative things to do with plain old boxes. It reminds me how kids like myself used our imaginations in a useful and fun way.Thank goodness for DVD. We can again enjoy shows like this, as well as old school "Sesame Street," "The Electric Company," "New Zoo Revue" and "Zoom."
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Magic Tree, the Story Box, the Chuckle Patch and Sherlock are back!! Unlike many other childrens' shows which do not live up to their beloved memories, The Magic Garden does not disappoint, even almost 40 years after its initial release. Carol and Paula both have amazing chemistry due to their long time real-life friendship, something that cannot be duplicated by throwing two people into a show together. Great stories, wonderful songs, and two ladies, who are as nice as they are talented, still manage to keep today's kids glued to the TV set. An excellent show that won many awards finally gets the DVD release that so many people have been waiting for. Hopefully, more episodes will be on the way.
summary: One of the all-time best childrens' shows get much-deserved DVD release
Title: N/A

reviewText: I ordered this for my almost five-year-old granddaughter for Christmas because I knew my daughter had loved Carole and Paula when she was seven.  Some 37 years ago she recited the jokes and sang the songs, and we even bought her the record album.  My husband took one look at the DVD set when it came and asked, "Are you sure this isn't for Rachel (our daughter)?"  I sort of wondered myself which one I was buying it for.  However, we watched our granddaughter a week later, and she was reciting jokes from the Chuckle Patch, singing songs, and telling us about Sherlock the puppet.  She said she watches the DVD every night before she goes to sleep.  We surprised her when we showed her the album her mother played to death as a little girl.  And the album cover is the real treasure.  It was left uncolored by the manufacturer so little ones could color it in themselves.  We showed our granddaughter the album cover her mother had colored, and then we played the record for her - and listened as she sang along.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved the Magic Garden. I remember this show when it aired on Channel 11 in New York and I lived in New Jersey. It was always on around 2 P.M. every day like clockwork. Even during the summer months out of school, I went in to watch Carole and Janis and friends. For a half-hour, they sang songs, told stories, and taught a lesson. I never knew that there were only 52 episodes. Unfortunately, there are only 10 here. I always thought there had to be hundreds and I probably saw them a dozen times. Thirty years later, I kind of yearn for that period of life when my worry was missing the Magic Garden. I think we all need the Magic Garden in our lives. If you have young children, I highly recommend this show and if there are preschool educators out there. This show is not only wholesome but entertaining and educating and fun as well.
summary: We All Need the Magic Garden in Our Lives!

reviewText: 'Just got these DVD's today... When I heard this was released, I ordered it and *HAD TO DO* 1-day shipping, could not wait!!!  I am a well-adjusted 39 year-old gay guy, professional airline flight attendant of 18 years, in suburban NJ... THE MAGIC GARDEN was one of the most AWESOME 30-minutes of my day as a child in the '70's!!!  Watching the show makes me feel like it was 5 minutes ago, NOT 30+ years ago!!  I almost cried watching the first DVD tonight!!  I even remember writing letters to Paula & Carole in grade school and receiving picture postcards back, signed from Paula & Carole!!  The shows are amazing... these LADIES ARE AMAZING!!!!  Even now, at 39, I can appreciate the *adult humor* and banter between Carole & Paula even more NOW than when I was 7 years-old!!  Carole & Paula, if you are reading this, please know.... YOU 2 MADE A DIFFERENCE!!!!!  Love you both!!!  You 2 wonderful women who made a difference in my life as a child... AND made it even BETTER!!  THANK YOU!!!  WZ from NJ  :)  :)
Title: N/A
